unittitle.value: Herman W. Benson Typescript "Insurgency and Reform in the Painters Union, 1960-1967"

abstract.value: Herman W. Benson is a union member and labor journalist. This collection contains a typescript of an unpublished paper by Herman W. Benson regarding the reform movement in the Brotherhood of Painters, Decorators and Paperhangers in the 1960s.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Herman W. Benson Typescript "Insurgency and Reform in the Painters Union, 1960-1967"; WAG 280; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.280.

Herman W. Benson was a member of the United Auto Workers and the United Rubber Workers. As a 
labor journalist, he served as the trade union editor of<emph render="italic"> Labor Action</emph> and as editor and publisher of <emph render="italic">Union Democracy in Action</emph>. Benson is the author of <emph render="italic">Democratic Rights For Union Members: A Guide To Internal Union Democracy </emph>.
This collection contains a typescript of an unpublished paper by Herman W. Benson regarding the reform movement in the Brotherhood of Painters, Decorators and Paperhangers in the 1960s.
